snippet: The lavish spending and questionable performance of a company that provided therapy to young children underscores problems in a segment of New York’s special education program.
abstract: Lavish spending and questionable performance of Bilingual SEIT, Queens company that provided therapy to 3- and 4-year old children with developmental disabilities, underscores problems in segment of New York’s special education program; firm's billings to city and state soared to over $17 million in 2011-12 school year, but many of the children did not get the care they needed.

byline.contributor: Griff Palmer and Tom Torok contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The lavish spending and questionable performance of a company that provided therapy to young children underscores problems in a segment of New York’s special education program.

headline.seo: For Special Ed Contractor, Huge Fees and Shoddy Care
headline.main: For Contractor in Special Ed, Huge Fees and Poor Care
headline.print_headline: Soaring Charges By a Contractor With Special Ed
